channel.title: Already got my (help) thanks to all you people
channel.description: ok, so... usually on 317's the total combat level is 126 i was wondering if there was a way when they got 99str,att,def,hp... it would make them lvl 138.. without summoning in 317..

item.title: Already got my (help) thanks to all you people
item.dc:creator: @mangalover51 mangalover51
item.description:
@mangalover51 wrote:

this is what i have from combat in player.java and btw i had this in my client.java lol

and d crew thank for leading me to the right direction thank’s but i did it my self

decreases when your hp or any of these skills get lowerd, this fixes that problem.
/* int att = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325);
int def = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25);
int str = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325);
int hit = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25);
int mag = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875);
int pra = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125);
int ran = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875);*/

    /* int mag = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5);
     int ran = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5);
     int attstr = (int)((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])));

     int combatLevel = 0;
     if (ran > attstr) {
     combatLevel = (int)(((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875));
     } else if (mag > attstr) {
     combatLevel = (int)(((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875));
     } else {
     combatLevel = (int)(((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325) + ((double)(getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325));
     }
     playerProps.writeByte(combatLevel);		// combat level
     playerProps.writeWord(0);			// incase != 0, writes skill-%d

     str.writeByteC(playerProps.currentOffset);		// size of player appearance block
     str.writeBytes(playerProps.buffer, playerProps.currentOffset, 0);
     }*/


    int mag = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5);
    int ran = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5);
    int attstr = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]))
            + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])));

    int combatLevel = 0;

    if (ran > attstr) {
        combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875));
    } else if (mag > attstr) {
        combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875));
    } else {
        combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325)
                + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325));

i got it my self now i jsut added slayer into all of these but my lvl is 145 now 138 lol oops oh well thx guys that tried

item.title: Already got my (help) thanks to all you people
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Dcrew Mod Dcrew
item.description:
@Mod_Dcrew wrote:

Find this in player.java!

public void getCombat() { int j = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerAttack]); int k = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerDefence]); int l = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerStrength]); int i1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints]); int j1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerPrayer]); int k1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerRanged]); int l1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerMagic]); combatLevel = (int)(((double)(k + i1) + Math.floor(j1 / 2)) * 0.25D) + 1; double d = (double)(j + l) * 0.32500000000000001D; double d1 = Math.floor((double)k1 * 1.5D) * 0.32500000000000001D; double d2 = Math.floor((double)l1 * 1.5D) * 0.32500000000000001D; if(d >= d1 && d >= d2 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d; } else if(d1 >= d && d1 >= d2 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d1; } else if(d2 >= d && d2 >= d1 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d2; } else if(extraCb > 0) { combatLevel = extraCb; } }

Change it to

public void getCombat() { int j = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerAttack]); int k = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerDefence]); int l = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerStrength]); int i1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints]); int j1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerPrayer]); int k1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerRanged]); int l1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerMagic]); int slayerExtra = 0; if (playerLevel[18] >= 96) { slayerExtra = 12; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 88) { slayerExtra = 11; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 76) { slayerExtra = 10; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 70) { slayerExtra = 9; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 64) { slayerExtra = 8; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 54) { slayerExtra = 7; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 48) { slayerExtra = 6; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 36) { slayerExtra = 5; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 24) { slayerExtra = 4; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 18) { slayerExtra = 3; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 10) { slayerExtra = 2; } else if (playerLevel[18] >= 4) { slayerExtra = 1; } combatLevel = (int)(((double)(k + i1) + Math.floor(j1 / 2)) * 0.25D) + 1 + slayerExtra; double d = (double)(j + l) * 0.32500000000000001D; double d1 = Math.floor((double)k1 * 1.5D) * 0.32500000000000001D; double d2 = Math.floor((double)l1 * 1.5D) * 0.32500000000000001D; if(d >= d1 && d >= d2 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d; } else if(d1 >= d && d1 >= d2 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d1; } else if(d2 >= d && d2 >= d1 && extraCb == 0) { combatLevel += d2; } else if(extraCb > 0) { combatLevel = extraCb; } }

Made myself so please REP or thank atleast.

Read full topic

item.title: Already got my (help) thanks to all you people
item.dc:creator: @Shadowswoz Shadowswoz
item.description:
@Shadowswoz wrote:

Should be located in Player.java… Search for combat until you get to the formula, it’ll look something similar to this:

        int combatLevel = 0;

        if (ran > attstr) {
            combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875));
        } else if (mag > attstr) {
            combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875));
        } else {
            combatLevel = (int) (((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325)
                    + ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325));
        }

Just change the multiplication values to equal the number you want

Read full topic
